Welcome to the Documentation for vLabtool-v0¶

Introduction¶

A cost effective, multi-pronged data acquisition tool to turn your computer into a workbench for science and electronics experiments.

  • Introduction
    • What is the SEELablet?
    • The Various Measurement and Control tools
    • Launching the Graphical Apps
    • Example Videos of the SEELablet
      • Daisy Chained RGB LEDs(WS2812B) being controlled via Python
      • 4-Channel Oscilloscope in action
      • 4-Channel Logic Analyzer with PWM inputs
      • Wireless node being used with accelerometers and gyroscopes
      • Frequency Counter accuracy tests with Agilent 33220A counter
      • Voltage Streaming utility demo
      • Linear Optical Array Demo

Graphical Apps¶

  • General Purpose Applications for Real World interaction
    • Oscilloscope
    • Plot return values from various commands as a function of time
    • Acquire and plot data from supported I2C Sensors
    • Control Up to 4 servo motors using the PWM outputs (SQR1 - 4)
    • wireless sensors application
  • Experiment Specific Graphical Utilities
    • Study Common Emitter characteristics of NPN transistors
    • Diode IV Characteristics

Python Library¶

  • Python module for accessing the device
    • Connecting to the device
    • Sub-Instance I2C of the Interface library contains methods to access devices connected to the I2C port.
    • Sub-Instance SPI of the Interface library contains methods to access devices connected to the SPI port.
    • Methods to access wireless sensor nodes
    • Function reference

Advanced Modules¶

  • SPI_class module
  • I2C_class module
  • NRF24L01_class module
  • NRF_NODE module
  • experiment module
  • Applications
    • Module contents
